label: 衛府
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Headquarters (fu) in charge of guarding the Imperial Palace. There were regularly Six Headquarters of the Guards (Roku-efu). At first there were the Headquarters of the Gate Guards, (Emonfu), Middle Imperial Guards (Chūefu), Palace Guards, Left Division (Saejifu) and Right Division (Uejifu), and Military Guards, Left (Sahyōefu) and Right Divisions (Uhyōefu). Later these became the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards, Left (Saemonfu) and Right Divisions (Uemonfu), Middle Palace Guards, Left (Sahyōefu) and Right Division (Uhyōefu), and Inner Palace Guards, Left (Sakon'efu) and Right Divisions (Ukon'efu). The last four headquarters were known as the Four Headquarters of the Guards (Shi-eifu). Refer- eji, Gaiefu, Hyōefu (Headquarters of the Military Guards), and Hyōefu (Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards). [府、六衛府、衛門府、中衛府、左衛士府、右衛士府、左兵衛府、右兵衛府、左近衛府、右近衛府、四衛府、衛士、外衛府、兵衛府]
